s1.message: Anyone can contribute code to any of our projects. But if you're contributing to a project on a regular basis, it makes sense to request commit access.

s2.message: To become a committer for a project, ask the module owner responsible for it. Make sure to include the following:

s3.message: A list of your past contributions - the module owner will decide whether to grant you access based on those.

s5.message: Note that whether you're a committer or not, every change needs to be reviewed by the respective module owner.

s6.message: Also note that we will revoke commit access for anyone who has been inactive for a while. Just ask again if that happens to you.
